enWisdom: Repetition of [the] reprimand is more severe than the pain of a beating
Reproof is one of the two punishments

Wisdom: الْإِفْرَاطُ فِي الْمَلَامَةِ يَشُبُّ نَارَ اللَّجَاجَةِ
enWisdom: Excessiveness in reproach ignites the fire of obstinacy

Wisdom: احْذَرِ الْكَرِيمَ إِذَا أَهَنْتَهُ وَالْحَلِيمَ إِذَا جَرَحْتَهُ وَالشُّجَاعَ إِذَا أَوْجَعْتَهُ
enWisdom: Be cautious of the noble-minded person when you offend him, and the forbearing one when you injure him, and the courageous one when you torment him

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ أَنْ تَكُونَ عَلَى النَّاسِ طَاعِناً وَلِنَفْسِكَ مُدَاهِناً فَتَعْظُمَ عَلَيْكَ الْحَوْبَةُ وَتُحْرَمَ الْمَثُوبَةَ
enWisdom: Beware of being critical of the people while going easy on yourself, thereby rendering your sin grave and being deprived of reward

Wisdom: وَإِيَّاكَ أَنْ تُكَرِّرَ الْعَتْبَ فَإِنَّ ذَلِكَ يُغْرِي بِالذَّنْبِ وَيُهَوِّنُ الْعَتْبَ
enWisdom: Beware not to continuously scold them for this will incite them to commit sins and make it easy for them to bear the scolding [as they will become accustomed to it]
When you reprimand then leave some room [to make amends and do not be excessive in reprimanding]
When you [have to] censure [someone], make it short

Wisdom: طَعْنُ اللِّسَانِ أَمَضُّ مِنْ طَعْنِ السِّنَانِ
enWisdom: The piercing of the tongue is more injurious than the piercing of the spear
Blame may at times be beneficial

Wisdom: مَنْ شَمِتَ بِزَلَّةِ غَيْرِهِ شَمِتَ غَيْرُهُ بِزَلَّتِهِ
enWisdom: ne who is gleeful of the mistakes made by others, [then] others will be gleeful of his mistakes
One who informs you of your vilification has [himself] vilified you

Wisdom: مَا تَسَابَّ اثْنَانِ إِلَّا غَلَبَ أَلْأَمُهُمَا
enWisdom: Two people never insult each other except that the one who is wicked of the two prevails
